titleStmt.title: The honour of the gentle-craft expressed in three stories: the first o[f] Hugh and fair Winifred. The second of Crispin and Crispiannus. The third of Sir Symon Eyre; wh[o] all professed the gentle-craft, and were shoo-makers. Newly written. With pleasant new sings to be sung on Crispianus nigh[t.]

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A. Clark for T. Passenger on London Bridg [sic],

notesStmt.note: Place of publication conjectured by cataloger.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
